meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or affected with scurvy.
meanings.sent1: The sailor's pale skin and weak appearance were clear signs of his scorbutic condition.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed fresh fruits to treat the scorbutic symptoms.
meanings.sent3: When the pirate turned down the oranges, his crewmates joked that he was being scorbutic.
meanings.sent4: The neglected garden had a scorbutic look, with wilted plants and yellowing leaves.
meanings.sent5: The scorbutic smell of the old, moldy ship made everyone cringe.

meanings.sent1: The lack of vitamin C in their diet led to the scorbutic outbreak on the ship.
meanings.sent2: The scorbutic fruits were discarded due to their sour taste.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt at a new recipe turned out to be quite scorbutic.
meanings.sent4: The scorbutic conditions on the ship made it clear they needed to restock on fresh produce.
meanings.sent5: The scorbutic diet of only hardtack and water left the crew weak and fatigued.

meanings.sent1: The medic rushed to help the scorbutic on deck.
meanings.sent2: The captain ordered extra supplies to aid the scorbutic on board.
meanings.sent3: The crew gathered around the scorbutic, offering support and fresh fruits.
